introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• The 1791 Slave Trade Act was influenced by numerous abolitionist writings.
• One such work was The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano (1789).
• Equiano’s account described his experiences and hardships while enslaved.
• His writings were widely distributed in Britain and stirred public debate.
• This broad public response helped to sway legislators in favor of ending the slave trade.
question: The student wants to emphasize how Equiano’s writing contributed to legislative change. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Equiano described his life experiences in The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano.
B: Many abolitionist writings influenced the 1791 Slave Trade Act, but Equiano’s account was the most popular.
C: Because of broad public response to Equiano’s autobiography, it was among the works that swayed legislators to pass the 1791 Slave Trade Act.
D: The 1791 Slave Trade Act was influenced by writings describing the hardships of the enslaved.
explanation: Choice C explicitly explains that Equiano’s book stirred public debate and influenced the passage of the 1791 Act, using details from the notes.
